sections.title: Start With Net Operating Income
sections.content: Collect rental income, subtract vacancy reserves, and deduct all operating expenses (taxes, insurance, maintenance, management, utilities). The result is net operating income (NOI)—the foundation for every valuation metric.

points.title: Cap Rate
points.description: NOI divided by purchase price; use it to compare deals in the same market segment.

points.title: Cash-on-Cash Return
points.description: Annual pre-tax cash flow divided by cash invested (down payment + closing + rehab).

points.title: Debt Service Coverage
points.description: NOI divided by annual debt payments—aim for 1.2x or higher to keep lenders comfortable.

sections.title: Underwrite Repairs Honestly
sections.content: Budget 1–2% of property value per year for repairs plus a reserve for capital expenditures like roofs and HVAC.

sections.title: Underwriting Sprint
steps: Download a recent listing and pull public data for taxes, square footage, and last sale price.
Estimate market rent using comparable listings and adjust for bedrooms, condition, and parking.
Build a one-page pro forma with income, vacancy, expenses, and loan terms.
Compute cap rate, cash-on-cash return, and DSCR using your assumptions.
Create a stress-test tab that shifts rent ±5% and expenses ±10% to see sensitivity.

sections.title: Save Your Template
sections.content: Keep your pro forma in the cloud so every new property can be analyzed in minutes instead of hours.
